metadata.title: Portuguese Diagnostic Assessment - Production-Only
metadata.description: Comprehensive diagnostic test with granular topic tracking (A1→B2)
metadata.structure: Topic-based adaptive testing with soft failures and phase promotion

assessmentTypes.production: 130 questions - English to Portuguese with strategic chip options

metadata.changelog: v10.9: Removed all 117 hints for true assessment. v10.8: Removed contrived basic scenarios. v10.7: Fixed tense/scenario mismatches. v10.6: Separated definite/indefinite article chips. v10.5: Clear gender markers only (-o/-a/-os/-as). v10.4: Removed adjective scenarios. v10.0: Production-only (removed 177 comprehension questions). v8.0: Strategic streamlining. v7.1: Fixed ambiguities.
metadata.scenarioCoverage: Strategic - contextual where beneficial, removed for basic drills
metadata.questionTypes: Production (EN→PT with chips) and Multi-step only
metadata.approach: No hints, clear gender markers, separated article types, proper scenarios
metadata.diagnosticMode: Topic-based adaptive with 2-strike failures and 70% phase pass threshold

phases.name: Foundation (A1)
phases.description: Absolute beginner - basic identity, present tense, articles, simple verbs

phases.name: Elementary (A2)
phases.description: Elementary - past tenses, questions, comparisons, irregular verbs

phases.name: Upper-Intermediate (B2)
phases.description: Upper-intermediate - future tense, conditional, subjunctive moods, advanced usage

scoring.comprehensionOnly: Can understand but not produce - needs speaking/writing practice
scoring.both: True mastery - can understand AND produce
scoring.placementLogic: Last unit where BOTH comprehension AND production passed

questions.en: If a Portuguese noun ends in '-e', what is the rule for its gender?
questions.question: Choose the best description:
options: It can be either Masculine or Feminine.
It depends on the plural form.
questions.correct: It can be either Masculine or Feminine.

questions.en: If a Portuguese noun ends in '-l', what is the rule for its gender?
questions.question: Choose the best description:
options: It can be either Masculine or Feminine.
It depends on the singular form.
questions.correct: It can be either Masculine or Feminine.
